alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:18PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Big Horn County through 545 PM MDT... At 518 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Fort Smith to 18 miles south of Busby. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lodge Grass, Crow Agency, St. Xavier, Kirby, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Crow Indian Reservation and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
